page.title: 20The Canal
page.content: The Kennet and Avon Canal runs through our town and is a portion ofthe Avon navigation which formed part of a route from Bristol to London. The canal fell into disuse with the coming of the railway, the decline of quarrying and the woolen industry. Now the canal is being reborn. This resurrection is a fantastic feat of planning and organisation by enthusiasts dedicated to re-opening the sludged up, leaking, decrepit canal. Already many pleasure boats abound. They are mainly privately owned, small, powered, cabin cruisers and commercially run narrow boats converted for passenger travel. The canal is now an exciting growth area and it has begun to live again.
